author: sebastiengllmt
title: Cardano Rust SDK update for Alonzo
description: A lot of integrations in the ecosystem depend on this library (Coinbase and Yoroi for example) and it will stop working for Alonzo

assessments.note: This proposal addresses a key Yoroi integration with exchanges/wallets that must be updated before Alonzo.
This seems like a project that will be required by developers.
This proposal does address the challenge, the SDK library is used already by developers.
It's an important library that needs to be updated.
Proposal addresses something that could pose a significant bottleneck in the future if left unattended.
this seems that is wanted, but not necessarily as urgent as libraries for other programming languages that are more popular

This proposal is essential for nearly all developers in the cardano ecosystem. without updating the SDK there is a risk that many things stop working with Alonzo. who better to address this than the team that first wrote it?

The Rust SDK is already an essential piece of the Cardano Ecosystem, if it were not updated for Alonzo it would have a very bad impact and would cause many delays and problems. The team has a proven long time record within the community and as part of Emurgo.
A rust library update is very needed for Yoroi and several exchanges as Cardano moves into the Goguen era.
Emurgo is one of the founding Cardano teams and they are the builders of the Rust SDK
The proposers are updating their own SDK, thus likely to be successful.
The team has the experience necessary to do so.
As writers of the original library, you can't really get much more experienced than this.
Not much information and implementation details provided
This is the original team that built the SDK, and they have proven their skills many times all while being open with the community.

Here we must say that the names and proven track records of the team is what give them this 5 stars review. If it weren't for their previous achievements they would only get 3 stars at best. We know we can trust them because we know them and we know they'll deliver but they could have made more efforts to give a cost breakdown with a detailed plan and time schedule, and all the things that we require for other proposals. They should not abuse the community's trust.
The Emurgo team behind this proposal is a founding Cardano member with the developer talent/resources to implement this solution on budget/time.
This is a complete proposal from Nico and Seba of Emurgo
It would be nice to have some detail as to why 50,000 is the required amount to achieve this.
There are no timetables presented, nor a breakdown of the budget.

As with other proposals by the group members, they appear to be relying nearly exclusively on their existing reputation in the community rather than outlining a detailed proposal. The specific goalposts to "continue doing what we've been doing" are extremely vague and there is no rationale or breakdown of funding costs.
This proposal is easy to audit via github of the SDK.

As said in previous notes, the notoriety of the team is what gives them credit to deliver and be accountable, but this proposal is really lacking the standard information required (cost breakdown, time schedule, deliverables, links to profiles etc...). I give them 4 stars because as a long time member of the community myself I know who they are but solely based on the information in their proposal they deserve a rating of 2 or less. They should have been exemplary. Now the definition of success is clear: The Rust SDK will be compatible with Alonzo or it won't be, there's no real gradation.
The plan presented and more importantly the team behind it is sufficient to audit the progress/success of the proposal

solution: We will update this library for future updates to Cardano and also provide support & functionality to those who depend on it.
experience: The team already has experience creating the original library, and it's actively working on other initiatives for Alonzo.
